Fields.DialogueText: Ugh...Schlaf!...Schlaf, schlaf, du Dummkopf!
Roeder, what are you yelling about?
Toughness!
Eh?
Nothing is wrong, Kapitän! Ja! I am merely doing warm up repetitions to prepare ourselves against the Nixe.
... I would say nothing was wrong if your hat wasn't upside down.
Nein! You saw nothing!
Roeder...
Ja... Sleep has been eluding my grasp as of late, Kapitän.

Fields.MenuText: Do you read before going to bed?
Probably has something to do with the alcohol that keeps going missing...
What do you usually do before bed?

Fields.DialogueText: The past day's reports. The next day's checklists.
Nein! This has nothing to do with that conspiracy!
Äh...Recite all the Prussian virtues, a hundred push ups, and wash it down with a sip of Merlot.
Hm, sounds typical for you. I wonder why your sleeplessness has occurred out of nowhere.
Ich weiss es nicht...
I'll put more wine in your reserve if that will help any more.
Danke, but focus now!...
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Nixe! I will show you the meaning of exhaustion!
Herr Kapitän!
What is wrong, Roeder?
When was the last time I have asked you to show reliability?
Ah, can't say I remember, Roeder, why?
I have learned from other captains that if one is to demonstrate reliability, they must let go of control of their muscles.
Wait, what? Whoa, Roeder! Careful!
That, Freund, is what they call a "Vertrauensfall."
A little warning before trust-falling would be nice, Roeder...
That is the beauty of reliability. You will never know when you are in need and when you must stand strong!

Fields.MenuText: Never thought of it like that...
Please tell me next time you entrust your life with me though, Roeder.
Aren't you in high spirits today? Did you manage to sleep?

Fields.DialogueText: And that is why you have hired the best Destroyer in all of the German fleet, Kapitän!
Tsk. You do not understand the fragility of reliability at all.
Ein bisschen. Not exactly like a Stein.
Ah, the alarms. Ready?
If I am to rely on you, to always catch me, then ja.
Huh? What's that supposed to mean?
@BATTLE
(catches Roeder)
You almost crashed your skull on the floor...
*ALARM*
Nixe, bring all that you have! Let us see how you withstand the wind of Prussia!
Uh, I don't think you have to–
Kapitän, incoming projectile!
Aaaah! Oof...Roeder, are you all right?!
Hoo.... You are all right, Kapitän... I am... glad.
Get the on-call doctor on the deck immediately!
Tsk, Dummkopf. You think Schiffsdamen get beaten down by a measly shell? It didn't even detonate! Nothing but a moth sitting upon my arm.
That doesn't matter right now! Your head is bleeding.
Kapitän, as long as the main ship is not sunk, I will be fine. After all... I am a spirit, not of the flesh permanently.

Fields.MenuText: You're right, I'm sorry for embarrassing you in front of the crew.
That may be so, but you should still see the doctor to be safe...
May you never sink, Roeder.

Fields.DialogueText: More humility! I like you better with each passing day, Kapitän.
Kapitän. I am fine. Let the matter go before my crew suspects something. Now.
Do not joke with me, Kapitän. Type-1936 Destroyers do not sink without a struggle.
Now...let us resume where we left off, shall we?
Ah...right...
@BATTLE
Tsk... Like rubber...
Man... I'm starving... Chef, can I have a sandwich? What will you have today, Roeder?
None of his food is worthy.
But...I worked hard for the meal today!
Heh...And yet the food is absolutely deplorable, even with all that labor.
Roeder, what has gotten into you?
None of the food has any taste in my mouth. I cannot even force it down.
I didn't think his food was that bad...
Augh...Come here. Kapitän, that is not what I mean. The chef's food is köstlich. The food might not be the best, but I enjoyed it. Now...I cannot.
You could have said that to the chef too...
And have the crew know I have another side to me? Preposterous!

Fields.MenuText: What if I cooked you something instead?
How about we try to put more sugar in the food?
Have you tried adding more salt to the food?

Fields.DialogueText: Nein. You have other Schiffsdamen to attend to I imagine.
Uff... Dummkopf! You do not add sugar to a sandwich with cheese and meat!
Salt to a sandwich? Unless you want to kill all of the succulent flavors that already are in the meat, I will pass.
Roeder wait!...Chef, I still like the- Huh? Are you all right?
Hff...My sandwich...
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
My hands are cold. Shall we warm them up by strangling a Nixe?!
You would need longer arms for that.
Schweig! You were not permitted to interject!
@BATTLE
Okay. They're taken care of- Aaah!
Kapitän! Oof... Puh... I have grasped you in time. Punctuality!
Hah...heh, I guess that's one way to look at it. Thanks, Roeder. Huh? So that's what I tripped over...
Was it?! How did this depart from my pockets!?
What is it?
Mein Personalausweis. German Identity Card. I was given one by the crew to mark my existence among you all.
Huh...What do you use that card for anyway besides a representation?
... Liquor.
I should have known. What's this on the back?
Dummkopf!
Okay! Okay! I won't read the rest of it! I was just curious.
Hmph...I only let the people I care about know my pseudo name.

Fields.MenuText: I don't count?
I thought we had something special!
But, Roeder, I love you!

Fields.DialogueText: Nein. That is not what I meant!
What are you implying here!?
Dummkopf! Dummkopf! Dummkopf!
Nixen! I am going on ahead, Dummkopf!
I don't learn, do I?
*ALARM*
*ALARM*
"Pseudo name?" Like pseudonym? Lui- *OWW!*
Do not! Under any circumstances, do not!
Roeder, you've been snapping your fingers for the past twenty minutes.
Was? I was not aware of this event.
Well, that is fine. No one is near us to see you do that. What's wrong?
...Straightforwardness. Not required at this moment in time.
Eh?
I do not know what is wrong with me, but I do not wish to discuss the matter further at this point in time.

Fields.MenuText: Should I leave you alone?
I was just trying to help...
The cargo needs to be accounted for anyway. Take care of yourself, Roeder.

Fields.DialogueText: Ja. I need some time to myself if you do not mind. Close the door on your way out. Danke.
I know you were, but it is not required at this moment in time. Please leave.
Ja...
...What is happening to me?...
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Move it faster! The other Schiffsdamen will catch up to us shortly!
Jawohl, Schiffsdame!
Roeder! Waugh!
Uff... Kapitän, you need to learn to have more balance...
Why are we going at this fast of a pace anyway?!
Snickering among the other Shicffsdamen. It was circulating that my knowledge of German history is inferior!
I doubt they said that without them feeling your wrath.
Hmph. Other Schiffsdamen were ahead of us and I could not allow that. Diether von Roeder has to lead the flotilla!

Fields.MenuText: Doesn't it get tiring to be on the top?
Don't you get tired being fast?
Roeder, you have to slow down! We'll hit that coral reef!

Fields.DialogueText: Do you get tired of winning!?
Does accomplishment not rejuvenate you!?
Nein! There is no slowing! Mannschaft! Turn to starboard! There, Kapitän. We have avoided the collision.
Uh, Roeder.
Ja? Oh, fantastisch...
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Hm...OK. The papers from last week's attack should be over here and...Uh...Who's there? Roeder?! What are you doing so close?!
...Restraint.
Eh?
Restraint!
... Are you trying to restrain yourself from slapping me in the face? I can't recall I did anything wrong lately?
Tsk. Nein! That is not it!

Fields.MenuText: Straightforwardness, Roeder!
Loyalty, Roeder!
Subordination, Roeder!

Fields.DialogueText: Dummkopf! I told you, I am not perfect! I do not always have to be direct with my actions!
Loyalty!? You question my actions and bark to me about loyalty!? Aus meinen Augen, Herr Kapitän!
Do not act like you are in complete control of my ship, Dummkopf.
*OWW!*
That slap is to warn you of the Nixe approaching us at an alarming rate.
I much prefer the alarm... My face... It burns.
@BATTLE
*SLAP*
Hmph.... gar nicht mal so schlecht diesmal. It's tolerable.
The plans or the Knieperkohl?
You doubt me! Of course the Knieperkohl!
But what's wrong with my plans?!
Hah... And our captain is the shining pupil of Prussian virtues. Kapitän, look over here. Can you not see why we cannot shelter there?

Fields.MenuText: Because I lack a sense of order?
What do Prussian virtues have to do with my battle strategy?
Because we're running away from a sense of duty?

Fields.DialogueText: I was not going to bring up what you lack, but what you had. But sure, sense of order.
Everything, Kapitän!
Hm, you still claim the title of my pupil then.
Ja, we are running away from a sense of duty! Taking shelter from Nixe will only boost their egos and hurt crew morale.
It would be a suicide mission!
Not if we unleash the wrath of Prussia.
... I'm not allowed to argue against you right now, am I?
Nein!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
... "One of these days?" Then there will be no time for Bier oder Wein!
Hey Roeder! Huh? You're standing outside the doctor's office?
I can stand where I well please, Kapitän. Since when am I not allowed to manifest on my ship?
I didn't say that, Roeder. I was just askin–
Then ask why you are accusing your beloved German Schiffsdame of loitering!
Accusing? Beloved?!
Forget it. Nein, it is nothing.

Fields.MenuText: Beloved is an interesting word to describe yourself. I thought you didn't like the attention?
Did I say something wrong?
What's on your mind?

Fields.DialogueText: I never do! I still don't! Augh... Dummkopf! You are such a Dummkopf!
Nein.
Nothing for the likes of you, Dummkopf.
Really sounds like I said something wrong...
... You did nothing wrong.
Okay.
Hah.... huh....
Roeder?
Nichts. I am fine. Apologies for that scene here.
*ALARM*
The alarms have a different plan for us, it seems.
On deck!
Schwarz, weis, schwarz. The flag of my people! Burn it in your memory, widerliche Nixe!
@BATTLE
Back in that battle, you waved an interesting flag in the wind. Black-white-black, "Gott mit uns?"
Danke, Kapitän. It was... perhaps less appropriate than the current Reichsflagge. And the eagle was more striking in the older flags. But I had this at hand, and it felt right.
Hm. It's amazing how much sentiment can get caught up in a bunch of cloth. Pride of nation first and foremost, obviously.
Na sicher! I would be ashamed to be a part of another country or culture.
Why is that?
What other country can boast of such strong victories, food, and discipline!?

Fields.MenuText: United States?
United Kingdom?
Portugal?

Fields.DialogueText: Are their states really so united? I think not!
You really think their food is something to boast about?
That klitzekleine country could not comprehend the vast stretch of Germany!
Anyway, no matter what country one is from, they better take pride in being there. Otherwise, the whole entity falls.
That's quite deep.
Deeper than the torpedoes that are aimed at us, at any rate.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
The Free State of Prussia service flag, if I'm not mistaken. Quite striking.
Nein! Stay up! Ja... Careful... Keep going... Neeeein!
Whoa, that almost crashed into me. What are you doing, Roeder?
It is not what it–
Is that a stick in your hand?
Nein! Fatigue must have conquered your head, Kapitän! What I have in my hand is not a stick, but a highly advanced baton!
... A baton?
Ja, for who else will the circle contraption listen to without the baton?
I'm not sure I understand, Roeder.
Gut. Leave it as such then! I am busy now, so leave at once!

Fields.MenuText: You're playing hoop and stick, aren't you?
Where did you get this stuff?
That isn't a baton, Roeder...

Fields.DialogueText: What gave you that ridiculous notion? How dare you question my performance and actions! Me?! Diether von Roeder!
I am not allowed to disclose that information with you.
It is, na sicher! What else would a baton look like?! Only of the finest wood is it made of!
I had enough of your antics. Please be off with you!
Heh, have fun, Roeder. You look kind of cute when you're excited.
Was!? Get back here!...Oof! If anyone heard what the Captain just said...They would not believe me. For now, this game must be executed properly. How do I keep this Reifen going?
*ALARM*
Leave the Morganas to me, Roeder. I wouldn't want to interrupt you.
@BATTLE
Past battles over there, and future plans are over here...Augh...my head–
What seems to trouble you, Kapitän?
Aah! Oh, just you, Roeder. I have a bit of a headache trying to organize everything by dates and the numbers started to blur together.
Hmph.
Huh? Ow!
Your temperature is around 37.2 C. Not lethal, but erhöht.
Do people normally flick people's foreheads to check their temperature nowadays?
Probably.
Uh-huh. Do I want to know how it works, or...
Nein, Kapitän. If I were to give you the secrets of my life, what good would I be? Nichts.

Fields.MenuText: You don't have to be that dramatic about it, Roeder.
Of course you would still be useful. Your value is not dictated by how you take people's temperatures.
Roeder, don't talk like that...

Fields.DialogueText: Never will you understand the pains of being a Schiffsdame.
Warme Worte to an iced heart. Danke.
... I need to be alone...
I can't tell if I will ever get closer to her or not.
*ALARM*
*Sigh* When it rains, it pours. No rest for the wicked!
@BATTLE
Are you all right now, Roeder?
Nein! Do you know of the Japanese?
Japan is one of the known countries helping us in this war.
Helping us!? Pah! Anyway, some Japanese have a world view known as "Wasabi."
I think you mean "Wabi-Sabi".
Ist jetzt auch egal! As I understand it, it means things should be "out of order" to achieve "harmony" - which makes no sense!
Why is that?
How does one become harmonious in chaos?! Blood, death, cries. It is not possible to become harmonious in disarray! Where is their sense of order!?
Maybe they find beauty in places that could not be seen?

Fields.MenuText: Like you!
Japanese culture is rather famous in some quarters for its aesthetic development.
... Like me!

Fields.DialogueText: Was!? Unverschämtheit! Insolence!
How dare you talk of them in such high regard!
Is that a joke?
Please don't come after me with that wine bottle.
The Nixe saved you instead.
I feel like this is deja vu for me...
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
But...
Listen, Schwachkopf. If the Kapitän wanted to be disturbed, I would be the first to know. Right now, the Kapitän needs peace. Leave! At once!
I just wanted to get this report in.
Roeder? What are you doing?
Ever since that bomb incident, I am careful who may come to you now. No one gets in or out!
But...
Nein! No "but!" Your safety is priority Ein! Do not be so careless about your own safety.
Roeder, that's great and all but...
You will not be endangered under my watch!

Fields.MenuText: But I have to get out of the control room...
Would I do this to you?
Incorruptibility. You are failing that while allowing fear to take over you, Roeder.

Fields.DialogueText: Nein! Never will it happen!
Ja, if you care a millimeter for my safety!
Prussian virtue recitation will not rescue you here, Kapitän.
Seriously, I have to go to the bathroom.
A glass jar was provided in the control room.
Wait, I can't do my business there!
In dire circumstances where we cannot be outside, it is necessary.
The Morganas are coming.
They will not touch you ever again while I am alive! Vorwärts!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Roeder?! Are you in here?! We got Morganas coming in fast from the southwest–
Huff....huff...
Roeder!? You're covered in sweat! Here... There... Hey, are you all right?
Kapitän...Uff....I...cannot breathe the cold air.
Wait, what happened?
All that I want, all that I would like to accomplish, fades before my eyes.

Fields.MenuText: What do you want?
What would you like to accomplish?
Why do you believe it will fade?

Fields.DialogueText: I want...warmth...Huff...Huff...
Everything. Everything I dreamed of in my life and hoped to succeed. But how can I do that...with such a body?
Because it will...that...is simple...Huff...Huff...
Come here... Take it easy; take deep breaths. In and out. Things will work out for both of us, Roeder. This war will end and you will be able to pursue whatever you want.
Do I make myself clear?
Ja.
Can you stand? We do really need your help with the Morganas right now.
Ja...They cannot stay near the ruthless Roeder for long!
@BATTLE
Morganas sailing from east and west, Roeder!
Hm...Troublesome.
Roeder?
@BATTLE
Inconvenient. All of these feelings...and...Kapitän. Most inconvenient of them all.
Roeder? You've been staring out at the ocean for awhile. Last time you did that you had something serious on your mind. What is wrong?
Roeder, where are you going?
Far away. Do not come after me.

Fields.MenuText: Roeder what is going on with you lately?
Please talk to me.
Do not leave. That is an order, Roeder.

Fields.DialogueText: If a person you care about is suffering, then you do well to stay away from her.
Only if you want the wound to remain open and to throw seawater on it.
Do not test yourself as you are still on my ship.
We're back to this...
*ALARM*
There are Morganas from all cardinal directions. It might be a long battle.
Bravery without sniveling!
Wha-what?
Pupil, I thought you knew better than to succumb to yourself.
Roeder, do you not see the amount of Morganas we have to face this time around? What is more, they have back up too if we're not–
Does that mean you have any right to complain!? Dummkopf!
Haven't heard that in awhile.
Heading a fleet into the hands of the Nixe, and here you are, complaining about length of an onslaught. How do you think morale would be?
I think I get what you mean, Roeder. I should be more considerate of my words.
That you should, ja. As the master of the German Schiffsdamen, you'll be wise to listen to me.

Fields.MenuText: All the time?
As you wish, Roeder.
How come I never noticed bravery without sniveling on the Prussian virtues list?

Fields.DialogueText: All the time, Kapitän. How else would you grow close?
Danke, Kapitän.
You lacked determination to read through the whole list, Kapitän.
Now, are we heading for these Nixen with bravery or are you going to go back to your home country crying?
No, we head forward!
The Japanese may not be Prussian, but we have this in common at least.
Hm?
Nichts, Kapitän. Let us head forward! Full speed!
@BATTLE
How about I slice your ships in two? Would that teach you, at last?
@BATTLE
Danke, gentlemen. We now have... twenty cases of Merlot and ten of Pinot Grigio. Thank you for your hospitality.
I wish you following winds.
Are those guys all right?
Ja, they were kind folk that gave us many wine cases, more than I care to finish in one night.
So this will be the rations for the crew then?
Ja.
Deep down, Roeder, you are a kind Belle. I hope you know that.
Not as kind as you.
Huh?
Nein! You heard nothing!

Fields.MenuText: I thought I heard something.
Not as "hind" as you? Is that what you said?
Could have sworn you gave me praise, but I couldn't hear correctly.

Fields.DialogueText: You heard nothing! The groans of my ship dissuade crew members at times. I have to tell the crew to do something about that.
Is that another joke of yours that I do not understand?
Because you heard incorrectly!
(abruptly) Merlot is a nice wine. Will you share a glass with me?
... Sure. Why not?
*ALARM*
Straightforwardness. It is on the virtue list! I have to abide by it! Straightforwardness with the Kapitän!
What did you need to be straightforward with me about, Roeder?
Ah! Kapitän, you do not need to manifest like a Schiffsdame!
Ha! Sorry - I didn't mean to alarm you. You looking for me, though?
Sort of. I must talk to you about something.

Fields.MenuText: Is it about the fact I was complimenting the Japanese?
Is it about the wine?
What did you want to talk about?

Fields.DialogueText: ... Nein. However, that did upset me. But never mind that now!
Nein, it is not about Wein. That is kept in a top secret location that I will never reveal. Even to you, Kapitän.
Well...
I must confess that I have.... how to say this... Herzrasen. Heart palpitations.
Wait, you're not doing all right?
Not like that, Kapitän, nein.
Roeder, that's a serious condition that you need checked out. We haven't had any engine problems, but-
Wait, you misunderstand...
Doctor! We need your help with Roeder's heart!
Dummkopf!
*ALARM*
Allow me. I need to vent my frustrations...
@BATTLE
Alas, poor Yorick!
Shall I applaud?
Nein. Nixen have arrived.
Heh, all right.
@BATTLE
I didn't know you loved Shakespeare.
I do not. However, I have read Hamlet. And I know Ophelia.
She suffers due to her desire to please both men in her life. Later she succumbs to insanity when Hamlet kills her father and when he breaks her heart.
Whether she died by accident or not, I understand her pain. Just a little.
Her insanity is scary to imagine sometimes.
Ja...
What's been going on with you lately anyway? You've been acting awfully strange around me.
I'd rather not say right now.

Fields.MenuText: Did someone say something to you?
You can trust me, Roeder.
What is truly eating at you, Roeder?

Fields.DialogueText: Nein! Why would you assume that!?
Ich weiss. Danke, Kapitän. But I just cannot do this deed right now.
A lot of things, Kapitän. One of them involves you.
The heart palpitations in my heart will not cease...
Come to think of it, the doctor ruled out anything wrong with your heart. Why do you believe you still have them?
Tsk. You will never understand a Schiffsdame's heart!
Roeder, wait!
Maybe I need to get her to a heart specialist?
... Nein. Shakespeare loses too much in English.
Ach, armer Yorick! – Ich kannte ihn, Horatio, ein Bursche von unendlichem Humor, voll von den herrlichsten Einfällen.
Er hat mich tausendmal auf dem Rücken getragen, und jetzt, wie schaudert meiner Einbildungskraft davor!
Fear these insignias branded on my coat! Know them well, Nixe, for they are the last thing you will see in this realm!
@BATTLE
For the longest time, I haven't really studied your coat of arms. Coats of arms, I guess - you have a lot of them!
Na sicher! Each Coat represents something different, Kapitän. I'm glad you took interest in them.
If you look here, we have the Coat of Arms of von Roeder (our sister's heritage name).
Then we have the Coat of Arms of Potsdam, which represent Brandenburg since I am of the place in the depth of my soul...
Why haven't you shown this to me now?
Like you said yourself, you only took notice now. But be wary, Kapitän, if you notice things late, there is not always time to reverse a change.
Uh, I'll try to be more attentive to you?
Heh.
What?
I think this is the first time I hear you say that. It gives me... warmth to hear you say this.

Fields.MenuText: We've been through hell together, Roeder. I'd be crazy to think I wouldn't try to improve anything with you.
I hope to continue to give you warmth, Roeder.
I wasn't the one who slammed a Prussian virtue list in my face!

Fields.DialogueText: That brings a fire in my heart . Please do not burn my soul.
And I will do my best to continue to protect you in exchange, Kapitän.
Only the details, Kapitän!
Come to think of it, you never told me what you were doing outside the doctor's office the other day.
That is because...
I won't force it out of you.
Huh?
I think I've learned my lesson, Roeder. Tell me when you're ready.
... Danke.
Fear the wrath of Prus- Nein! The letter!
Whaaa! Uff...Got it...
You almost fell off the railing, Dummkopf. It does not matter if it was something valuable of mine or not - do not do that again...
I suppose that was careless. Would hate to have you upset though, Roeder.
Ah...
@BATTLE
Kapitän, about earlier... Danke.
It was nothing.
But... it helped maintain my friendship with a true gentleman.
Why, thank you, Roeder.
I wonder... if maybe, when this war is over, we can talk again. As friends.

Fields.MenuText: I think you mean as lovers.
But we're already friends.
What do you mean?

Fields.DialogueText: Dummkopf! Y-you know that is not what I meant!
Ja, but friends that can see each other more frequently than this.
I want to be friends in a way that is closer than regular friends.
I guess you mean you want to be best friends... that's it isn't it?
Roeder, I just want to see you happy.
*ALARM*
Kapitän, we have to get you out of here. Part of the ship is unstable as is.
Roeder, we're fine. Your ship only maintained a few damages, but we're both ok.
Nein! Do you know what might happen even with the slightest damage? Failures. Everywhere! We are not taking any chances right now.
Roeder, I promise–
Can you promise all the men and women that have died when I promised to protect them?!
Roeder...
You are all that I have in this world! I do not mean to lose you! Not in this pathetic war!

Fields.MenuText: I'm not gonna die here, Roeder, I promise. Really.
None of us are going to die. Least of all you, Diether von Roeder.
We're going to be fine, Roeder.

Fields.DialogueText: ... I want to believe you.
... Kapitän.
Your words bring a sense of warmth to my heart.
Fine... I will be on deck fighting the Nixe.
Whoa! Easy on the equipment, Roeder! Roeder? Roeder!
@BATTLE
*BOOM*
We are about to go into battle. I hope Roeder is fine...
@BATTLE
Roeder, come to me.
Kapitän?
I want to know what has been going on with you. You've been acting strange, and it's just getting... stranger.
You are one of the people I trust most in this fleet. But when it comes to how you act, I have no idea if I can rely on you. Which is why I want you to trust me and tell me what is going on.
Kapitän...
You can talk to me, Roeder. I promise.
Ever since I joined the Protection Force, I have been experiencing great pain. Pain, over losing everyone now. Seeing Karl die, feeling exiled from my sisters, and... you.
You make me angry sometimes though. You do not always follow the Prussian virtues but...
For some reason, I want to always make sure you are smiling. For you to live another day longer than the rest of us.
My wish is to always be at your side and never go, but how do I do that when I do not know what tomorrow brings?
Is that what you were trying to do with your hand earlier? Trying and be affectionate but scared of doing so? And the same with the flicking and all the other oddities?
Ja...
Heh.
What is it?
All those things you did were cute.
S-stop! It-it is not like that, Dummkopf!

Fields.MenuText: It's all right, no one has to know about us two.
But it is like that!
Can't deny it now that we are a couple.

Fields.DialogueText: You think so? Ja, it would be easier if the other crew did not know. I must insist on it.
... Heh, it is, is it not?
A couple? Is this what it means to have the heart race then?
So those heart palpitations... you were actually telling me you had feelings for me!? Huh, now I feel bad for calling that other doctor.
Wait, you called another doctor?
Maybe...
Kapitän, what the flying hell, Dummkopf!
